\sphinxstepscope


\section{Introduction}
\label{\detokenize{introduction:introduction}}\label{\detokenize{introduction::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
BayesNetty is a C++ program written to perform Bayesian network analyses using genetic and phenotypic data.

\sphinxAtStartPar
BayesNetty is copyright, 2015\sphinxhyphen{}present Richard Howey, GNU General Public License, version 3.

\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] 
\item[] 
\end{DUlineblock}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxstylestrong{recommended use} of BayesNetty is to calculate the average network as described in \sphinxstyleemphasis{ref} average\sphinxhyphen{}network \sphinxstyleemphasis{/ref},
possibly additionally using imputation to fill in missing data as descibed in \sphinxstyleemphasis{ref} impute\sphinxhyphen{}data \sphinxstyleemphasis{/ref}.
However, for new users we reccomend you work your way through all sections in numerical order,
in order to understand the functionality of the program.

\printindex
